file_content.text: The hero of House Organa--we'll never forget your help.
Ulgo's commanders are dead.
Our scouts say Bouris Ulgo himself was heard raging when the news reached him.
The Panteers I've been speaking to are very, very impressed. Not to mention my superiors in House Organa.
I hope this gift in some way makes up for the risk you've assumed on our behalf.
We're all counting on you--Organa and Panteer both. Good luck.
Master Jedi -- I've heard of all your work for House Organa. Please, can you come to our aid once more? The Ulgos are preparing a surprise attack.
I'll do everything I can, but I'm going to need some details first.
Tell me how I can help.
All dangers can be overcome when the mind is at peace.
Calm yourself.
Yes... yes, you're right. Forgive me, but the situation is dire.
Lieutenant! Lieutenant, you made it! You've done so much already to preserve House Organa, but I need to ask your aid against a surprise Ulgo attack.
Just give me the situation, and we'll work out an op plan.
I'm all ears.
Excuse me. I've, ah, heard you've done great things in the service of House Organa. Were the price enough, would you come to our aid against an Ulgo sneak attack?
Surely the power of the Force would aid you better.
Why not a Jedi?
I sense great concern. What is it you need help with?
For what purpose?
A Jedi! And I thought my luck would never change. It's an invasion, Master Jedi--thousands of lives are at risk. Let me explain.
Republic Special Forces can handle anything, anywhere.
Why set your sights so low?
I don't come cheap.
If the price is right.
Money isn't the issue here. Manpower is.
Is this legit?
No, no! Nothing illicit, I assure you!
Excuse me? Please, I've heard of your good deeds for House Organa. Can we beg your aid once more? The Ulgos are massing for a surprise strike.
If the situation is that dire, then I should lend a hand.
That sounds serious.
If action is required, then action will be taken.
Then we'll stop it.
Your help would mean the world, Master Jedi.
Why don't you leave the military operations to me?
Sounds like my kind of work.
If... if you could help, that would be fantastic. We need all the help we can get.
I don't suppose there's any money in helping to stop this?
Sounds profitable.
Yes, of course. House Organa always honors its debts.
What are you talking about?
Oh, I'm... I'm sorry. The situation is dire--I'm afraid it's gotten the best of me.
Are you crazy or something?
What? No, you've... no. Forgive me--let me start again.
I'm a diplomat, sent here to represent House Organa. But since I've arrived, reports have poured in that House Ulgo is planning a surprise strike.
Ulgo's forces are mobile, well-trained. And House Panteer is, well, what's left of them are all bottled up here. Organa's armies will never make it here in time.
I won't let the Ulgos' invasion come to pass.
You can count on me.
The preservation of life should be our utmost concern.
Of course.
It's a relief to have your support in this, Master Jedi.
A pre-emptive surgical strike is the best option available.
Affirmative.
Um... yes. I think that's what I mean.
Long, bloody campaigns really aren't my style--best to get things over with.
Sure thing.
You make it all sound so simple.
Easy jobs are boring.
I suppose that's one way of looking at it.
The commanders of the Ulgo army are camped on the outskirts of the old Panteer castle. They'll have half their army camped around them.
Take out the generals and whatever they have planned will fall apart. Luck willing, it'll give us enough time to join with the Panteer in their defense.
Not a chance. [Refuse quest]
I... understand. I'll get in contact with my superiors and begin making necessary arrangements. Thank you for your time.
I don't think you can help me. Not now, anyway.
